reason: Task analysis: Identify which axis label word from a June 2022 AI regulation paper's three-axis figure is used to describe a type of society in an August 11, 2016 Physics and Society article. All three members executed identical systematic approaches with exceptional thoroughness and accuracy. Member evaluation: (1) Member 1 conducted comprehensive arXiv searches, successfully identified the AI regulation paper 'Fairness in Agreement With European Values: An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation' (arXiv:2207.01510v1) submitted June 8, 2022, extracted all six axis label words from Figure 1 (standardized-localized, egalitarian-utilitarian, subjective-objective), then located the Physics and Society paper 'Phase transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies driven by competition between cognitive and social constraints' (arXiv:1608.03637v1) from August 11, 2016, confirming 'egalitarian' describes a societal type. (2) Member 2 followed identical methodology with robust technical implementation, creating extensive documentation files, successfully identifying the same papers and confirming 'egalitarian' appears prominently in the Physics and Society paper title and content as a descriptor for non-hierarchical social structures. (3) Member 3 executed parallel research with systematic organization, achieving identical results through comprehensive searches and proper categorization. Convergence analysis: Perfect agreement across all members on both paper identification and final answer, with consistent methodology and verification. Cross-validation confirms 'egalitarian' is definitively correct - it appears as an axis label in the June 2022 AI regulation paper's three-axis figure and describes a type of society in the August 11, 2016 Physics and Society article. All members demonstrated exceptional research rigor, technical competence, and analytical precision. Confidence level: maximum.
